description: In base 10, if any power of 2 ends with k 2's and 3's, they must be the first k elements of this sequence in reverse order.
example: No power of 2 ends with 3, so the first term is 2.No power of 2 is == 22 mod 100, since 4 does not divide 22, so the next term is 3 (and 4 does divide 32).No power of 2 is == 332 mod 1000, since 8 does not divide 332, so the next term is 2 (and 8 does divide 232). And so on.
author: _David W. Wilson_
